Blocks¶

Block objects are dedicated to image analysis and/or modification and are aranged into Unit. The following diagram shows how an Image object is sequentially processed through the individual blocks of a unit. An example is provided here

A Block can write and read the properties of an Image object, providing a conveniant way to pass information from block to block.

Here is a list of all blocks available in prose:

Detection

DAOFindStars

DAOPHOT stars detection with photutils implementation.

SegmentedPeaks

Stars detection based on image segmentation.

SEDetection

Source Extractor detection

Alignment, registration and centroiding

XYShift

Compute the linear shift between two point clouds.

AstroAlignShift

Compute the linear shift between point clouds using astroalign

BalletCentroid

Centroiding with ballet.

Characterization

Gaussian2D

Fit an elliptical 2D Gaussian model to an image effective PSF

Moffat2D

Fit an elliptical 2D Moffat model expressed as

Photometry

PhotutilsAperturePhotometry

Aperture photometry using the CircularAperture and CircularAnnulus of photutils with a wide range of apertures.

SEAperturePhotometry

OUTDATED - TODO

Others

Calibration

Flat, Bias and Dark calibration

Trim

Image trimming.

Stack

Build a FITS stack image of the observation

SaveReduced

Save reduced FITS images.

Video

Build a video of all Image.data.
